revised_title: Equilibrium Spectrum of Wind-Generated Waves and Wave Breaking
tldr: The author calculates the loss of energy by wave breaking in a random sea state using the equilibrium spectrum of wind-generated waves. They find that the proportion of energy lost per mean wave cycle is independent of the frequency range, and estimate the constant in terms of the drag coefficient of the wind on the sea surface. The results suggest that the drag coefficient may decrease slightly as the wave age or non-dimensional fetch increases.
